intro: Hypochaeris arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider plant or woolly weed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by fluffy, white bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and covered in fine, white trichomes. Hypochaeris arachnoidea is an annual or biennial plant that can spread rapidly through seeds, making it both a weed and a hardy ornamental species.
